suncertify.db
Class Data

java.lang.Object
  suncertify.db.Data
All Implemented Interfaces:
DBAccess
public class Data
extends Object
implements DBAccess

Proprietary database of the URLyBird room reservation system.

Author:
Oliver Hernandez

Method Detail

getInstance

public static Data getInstance()
Get the singleton instance of Data.

Returns:
the singleton Data object.

open

public void open()
          throws IOException
Opens the database for usage. Should only be called once during the lifetime of the server.

Throws:
IOException - when an error occurs opening the database.

close

public void close()
Closes the database. No further operations should be called on it. Subsequent calls to this method will have no effect.

deleteRecord

public void deleteRecord(long recNo,
                         long lockCookie)
                  throws RecordNotFoundException,
                         SecurityException
Deletes the specified record from the database.

Specified by:
deleteRecord in interface DBAccess
Parameters:
recNo - the unique number of the record to update in the database.
lockCookie - the unique lock cookie (token) belonging to the single caller that can delete the specified record.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - when the specified record is not found or cannot be deleted from the database file.
SecurityException - when the record is locked with a cookie other than the specified cookie.
See Also:
DBAccess.deleteRecord(long, long)

findByCriteria

public long[] findByCriteria(String[] criteria)
Returns an array of record numbers that match the specified criteria. Field n in the database file is described by criteria. A null value in criteria[n] matches any field value. A non-null value in criteria[n] matches any field value that begins with criteria[n]. (For example, "Fred" matches "Fred" or "Freddy".)

Specified by:
findByCriteria in interface DBAccess
Parameters:
criteria - the search criteria to find records by.
Returns:
an array of the record numbers that match the criteria, or null if the database is closed.
See Also:
DBAccess.findByCriteria(java.lang.String[])

lockRecord

public long lockRecord(long recNo)
                throws RecordNotFoundException
Locks the specified record for exclusive access to modify it. This class expires locks after a timeout period specified by Configuration.getLockTimeout(). Therefore, if a client locks a record, it should unlock it within a reasonable amount of time. If it does not, such as the client crashing or an exception occurring before it could unlock the record, then this class will prevent the record from being locked indefinitely.

Specified by:
lockRecord in interface DBAccess
Parameters:
recNo - the number of the record to lock.
Returns:
a unique cookie (token) value
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - when the specified record is not found or the database is closed.
See Also:
DBAccess.lockRecord(long)

unlock

public void unlock(long recNo,
                   long cookie)
            throws SecurityException
Releases the lock on a record. Cookie must be the cookie returned when the record was locked; otherwise throws SecurityException.

Specified by:
unlock in interface DBAccess
Parameters:
recNo - the number of the record to unlock.
cookie - the unique cookie (token) value that must match the value when the record was locked.
Throws:
SecurityException - when the specified cookie value does not match the value when the record was locked, or if the lock expired.

readRecord

public String[] readRecord(long recNo)
                    throws RecordNotFoundException
Read a record from the database.

Specified by:
readRecord in interface DBAccess
Parameters:
recNo - the number of the record to read from the database.
Returns:
a String array containing each field value from the record.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - when the specified record is not found or the database is closed.
See Also:
DBAccess.readRecord(long)

updateRecord

public void updateRecord(long recNo,
                         String[] data,
                         long cookie)
                  throws RecordNotFoundException,
                         SecurityException
Updates the specified record with the specified field values.

Specified by:
updateRecord in interface DBAccess
Parameters:
recNo - the number of the record to update in the database.
data - the array of fields to update the record with.
cookie - the unique lock cookie (token) belonging to the single caller that can update the specified record.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - when the specified record is not found or the database is closed.
SecurityException - when the record is locked with a cookie other than the specified cookie.
See Also:
DBAccess.updateRecord(long, java.lang.String[], long)

createRecord

public long createRecord(String[] data)
                  throws DuplicateKeyException
Creates a new record in the database, and returns the record number where the new record is created within the database.

Specified by:
createRecord in interface DBAccess
Parameters:
data - the array of fields that make up the new record to create.
Returns:
the record number of the new record created, or -1 if the database is closed.
Throws:
DuplicateKeyException - when the record already exists.
See Also:
DBAccess.createRecord(String[])

toString

public String toString()
Returns a formatted String containing the entire contents of the database. Useful for testing purposes. If this is called after the database has been closed, "The database is closed." is returned.

Overrides:
toString in class Object
Returns:
the database as a formatted String.
